title: Authors and Citation
text: IKEDA T (2025). ggIRT: Visualize Item Response Category Characteristic Curves, Item Characteristic Curves, Item Information Curves, Test Information Curve. R package version 1.0.0, https://hedgehog2nd.github.io/ggIRT/.

title: Visualize Item Response Category Characteristic Curves, Item Characteristic Curves, Item Information Curves, and Test Information Curve
text: ggIRT R package provides functions visualizing results analyses using mirt ltm packages. following can done package: Visualization item characteristic curves (gg_irccc) Visualization item response category characteristic curves (gg_irccc) Visualization test information curves (gg_tic) Visualization item information curves (gg_iic) following functions implemented, planned added future Visualization ICC multiple group Visualization IRCCC multiple group Visualization test characteristic curves

title: Visualize Item Response Category Characteristic Curves, Item Characteristic Curves, Item Information Curves, and Test Information Curve
text: can install development version ggIRT GitHub :

title: Visualize Item Response Category Characteristic Curves, Item Characteristic Curves, Item Information Curves, and Test Information Curve
text: installation, can load package using library function. can draw IRCCC passing analysis results res item numbers mirt package arguments gg_irccc function. set grm argument FALSE, can draw ICC binary IRT. ggplot2 used visualization. also possible change axis labels apply original themes. can draw TIC passing analysis results mirt package argument gg_tic function.
code: library(ggIRT) library(mirt)  res <- mirt(data, itemtype = "graded")  gg_irccc(res, item = 1) gg <- gg_irccc(res, item = 1) gg + theme_bw() + labs(x = "THETA", y = "PROB.", title = "IRCCC item 1")  gg_tic(res)

title: Visualize Item Response Category Characteristic Curves, Item Characteristic Curves, Item Information Curves, and Test Information Curve
text: gg_irccc: Visualize Item Response Category Characteristic Curves (IRCCC) mirt ltm object.detail gg_iic: Visualize Item Information Curves (IIC) mirt ltm object.detail gg_tic: Visualize Test Information Curves (TIC) mirt ltm object.detail

title: Visualize Item Response Category Characteristic Curves, Item Characteristic Curves, Item Information Curves, and Test Information Curve
text: package requires following: R (>= 4.1.0) ggplot2 mirt ltm

title: Visualize Item Response Category Characteristic Curves, Item Characteristic Curves, Item Information Curves, and Test Information Curve
text: version 1.0.0 Updated March 26, 2025 (JST) Create README file. Create help file. Item information curve output now supported (gg_iic). gg_tic function now supports ltm grm objects. gg_tic function now supports binary IRT. avoid conflict ltm function, ltm argument changed use_ltm. fix gg_irccc function. version 0.1.0 March 24, 2025 (JST) released

title: calculate item information. — calculate_iic
text: calculate_iic Calculate item information volume item parameter obtained GRM 2PLM.

title: calculate item information. — calculate_iic
code: calculate_iic(object, item, theta, breaks, grm, use_ltm)

title: calculate item information. — calculate_iic
text: object mirt grm object. use grm object, must set use_ltm = TRUE. item numeric. number item visualized. length must 1. theta vector. length must 2. Specify range θ IRCCC visualized using c(). breaks numeric. Specifies number divisions theta. example, specify 1000, range specified theta divided 1000 parts. default 100. grm logical. default TRUE. default TRUE. using binary IRT　(2PLM) object, set TRUE. use_ltm logical. default FALSE. using object (either ltm object grm object) ltm package, set TRUE.

what: A category response probability is calculated from the item parameter. — calculate_irccc
title: A category response probability is calculated from the item parameter. — calculate_irccc
text: calculate_irccc Calculate category response probability item parameter.

title: A category response probability is calculated from the item parameter. — calculate_irccc
code: calculate_irccc(thetas, a, b, item, k, use_ltm)

title: A category response probability is calculated from the item parameter. — calculate_irccc
text: thetas vector. Theta latent value range calculating category response probability. value calculated theta breaks gg_irccc. numeric. length must 1. represents identification parameter. b vector. parameter difficulty level. item numeric. length must 1. value number item calculating category response probability. k numeric. Number rating categories given item. must 3 . use_ltm logical. default FALSE. using mirt object, set FALSE. using grm object ltm package, set option TRUE.

title: calculate test information. — calculate_test_info
text: calculate_test_info Calculate test information volume item parameter obtained GRM 2PLM.

title: calculate test information. — calculate_test_info
text: object mirt grm object. use grm object generated ltm package, must set use_ltm = TRUE. theta vector. length must 2. Specify range θ IRCCC visualized using c(). breaks numeric. Specifies number divisions theta. example, specify 1000, range specified theta divided 1000 parts. default 100. grm logical. default TRUE. default TRUE. using binary IRT　(2PLM) object, set TRUE. use_ltm logical. default FALSE. using object (either ltm object grm object) ltm package, set TRUE.

title: demo data — demo_data
text: dataset contains simulated responses 100 individuals 10 items, rated 5-point likert scale (1 5). data generated using graded response model item discrimination parameters ranging 0.1 3, difficulty thresholds increasing monotonically item.

title: demo data — demo_data
text: data frame 200 rows 10 variables: Item_1 Response item 1 Item_2 Response item 2 Item_3 Response item 3 Item_4 Response item 4 Item_5 Response item 5 Item_6 Response item 6 Item_7 Response item 7 Item_8 Response item 8 Item_9 Response item 9 Item_10 Response item 10

title: demo data — demo_data
text: demonstration data. resemblance actual persons, living dead, purely coincidental.

title: visualize Item Information Curves. — gg_iic
text: gg_iic Calculate item information volume item parameter obtained GRM 2PLM.

title: visualize Item Information Curves. — gg_iic
code: gg_iic(   object,   item,   theta = c(-3, 3),   breaks = 100,   grm = TRUE,   use_ltm = FALSE,   output.data = FALSE )

title: visualize Item Information Curves. — gg_iic
text: object mirt grm object. use grm object, must set ltm = TRUE. item numeric. number item visualized. length must 1. theta vector. length must 2. Specify range θ IRCCC visualized using c(). breaks numeric. Specifies number divisions theta. example, specify 1000, range specified theta divided 1000 parts. default 100. grm logical. default TRUE. using binary IRT　(2PLM) object, set TRUE. use_ltm logical. default FALSE. using object (either ltm object grm object) ltm package, set TRUE. output.data Logical. default FALSE. TRUE, instead visualizing IRCCC, data forms basis IRCCC output long format.

what: visualize IRCCC from mirt or ltm object. — gg_irccc
title: visualize IRCCC from mirt or ltm object. — gg_irccc
text: gg_irccc visualize IRCCC mirt ltm object.

title: visualize IRCCC from mirt or ltm object. — gg_irccc
code: gg_irccc(   object,   item,   theta = c(-3, 3),   breaks = 100,   grm = TRUE,   monochrome = FALSE,   use_ltm = FALSE,   output.data = FALSE )

title: visualize IRCCC from mirt or ltm object. — gg_irccc
text: object mirt grm object. use grm object, must set ltm = TRUE. item numeric. number item visualized. length must 1. theta vector. length must 2. Specify range θ IRCCC visualized using c(). breaks numeric. Specifies number divisions theta. example, specify 1000, range specified theta divided 1000 parts. default 100. grm logical. default TRUE. object GRM, set TRUE, binary type, set FALSE. monochrome logical. default FALSE, IRCCC output color. TRUE, IRCCC output black white. use_ltm logical. default FALSE. using mirt object, set FALSE. using grm object ltm package, set option TRUE. output.data Logical. default FALSE. TRUE, instead visualizing IRCCC, data forms basis IRCCC output long format.

title: visualize IRCCC from mirt or ltm object. — gg_irccc
text: Visualize IRCCC specified item mirt ltm object (output.data = FALSE). Output data can visualize IRCCC specified item mirt ltm object (output.data = TRUE).

title: visualize IRCCC from mirt or ltm object. — gg_irccc
code: #library(mirt) #data(Bock1997) #dat <- Bock1997[1:3] #res <- mirt(dat, model = 1, itemtype = "graded")  #gg_irccc(object = res, item = 1) #plot1 <- gg_irccc(object = res, item = 1) #plot1 + theme_bw()  #library(ltm) #res <- grm(dat[1:3], IRT.param = TRUE)  #gg_irccc(object = res, item = 1, use_ltm = TRUE) #d <- gg_irccc(object = res, item = 1, output.data = TRUE)

title: visualize Item Information Curves. — gg_tic
text: gg_tic Calculate item information volume item parameter obtained GRM.

title: visualize Item Information Curves. — gg_tic
code: gg_tic(   object,   theta = c(-3, 3),   breaks = 100,   se = TRUE,   grm = TRUE,   use_ltm = FALSE,   output.data = FALSE )

title: visualize Item Information Curves. — gg_tic
text: object mirt grm object. use grm object, must set ltm = TRUE. theta vector. length must 2. Specify range θ IRCCC visualized using c(). breaks numeric. Specifies number divisions theta. example, specify 1000, range specified theta divided 1000 parts. default 100. se logical. default TRUE. adding SE test information curve, set FALSE. grm logical. default TRUE. using binary IRT　(2PLM) object, set TRUE. use_ltm logical. default FALSE. using object (either ltm object grm object) ltm package, set TRUE. output.data Logical. default FALSE. TRUE, instead visualizing IRCCC, data forms basis IRCCC output long format.

title: generate column names. — rename_cols
text: rename_cols column names matrix category response probabilities obtained calculate_irccc used rating categories. rating category 10 , tens place column names rating categories 9 less padded zeros. example, rating category 7, becomes grade07.

title: generate column names. — rename_cols
text: k numeric. Number rating categories given item. must 2 .
